fullText: Director Bartlett Sher's handsome revival of the Lerner and Loewe musical preserves the show's old-fashioned elegance while subtly addressing its more problematic aspects.
dtliExcerpt: Director Bartlett Sher's handsome revival of the Lerner and Loewe musical preserves the show's old-fashioned elegance while subtly addressing its more problematic aspects.
bwwExcerpt: The changes are minor enough to go virtually unnoticed but sufficiently considered to fuel discussion among those convinced this light period piece has problems that needed addressing. Beyond that, it's a polished production with an accomplished - if not spectacular - cast. But it doesn't come close to the sweeping cinematic fluidity of Sher's best work, which filled the immense Beaumont stage with a majestic breadth seldom equaled. Nor does it approach the thrilling emotional engagement of those earlier shows.
